collection_readme.name: README.md
collection_readme.html:
ansible-mso

The ansible-mso project provides an Ansible collection for managing and automating your Cisco ACI Multi-Site environment. It consists of a set of modules and roles for performing tasks related to ACI Multi-Site.

Note: This collection is not compatible with versions of Ansible before v2.8.

Requirements

  • Ansible v2.8 or newer

Use

Once the collection is installed, you can use it in a playbook by specifying the full namespace path to the module, plugin and/or role.

- hosts: mso
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:
  - name: Add a new site EPG
    cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg:
      host: mso_host
      username: admin
      password: SomeSecretPassword
      schema: Schema1
      site: Site1
      template: Template1
      anp: ANP1
      epg: EPG1
      state: present
    delegate_to: localhost

author: Dag Wieers (@dagwieers)
description: Manage external EPGs in schema templates on Cisco ACI Multi-Site.
notes: Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: display_name
description: The name as displayed on the MSO web interface.

options.name: externalepg
description: The name of the external EPG to manage.

options.name: host
description: IP Address or hostname of the ACI Multi Site Orchestrator host.

options.name: output_level
description: Influence the output of this ACI module.
C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: template
description: The name of the template.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vrf
description: The VRF associated to this ANP.

suboptions.name: name
description: The name of the VRF to associate with.

suboptions.name: schema
description: The schema that defines the referenced VRF.
If this parameter is unspecified, it defaults to the current schema.

suboptions.name: template
description: The template that defines the referenced VRF.
If this parameter is unspecified, it defaults to the current template.

requirements: Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer
doc.short_description: Manage external EPGs in schema templates

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add a new external EPG
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_externalepg:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    externalepg: External EPG 1
    state: present
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Remove an external EPG
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_externalepg:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    externalepg: external EPG1
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a specific external EPGs
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_externalepg:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    externalepg: external EPG1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all external EPGs
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_externalepg:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

author: Dag Wieers (@dagwieers)
description: Manage contract filters in schema templates on Cisco ACI Multi-Site.
notes: Due to restrictions of the MSO REST API this module creates contracts when needed, and removes them when the last filter has been removed.
Due to restrictions of the MSO REST API concurrent modifications to contract filters can be dangerous and corrupt data.
Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

description: The name of the contract to manage.

options.name: contract_display_name
description: The name as displayed on the MSO web interface.
This defaults to the contract name when unset on creation.

options.name: contract_filter_type
description: The type of filters defined in this contract.
This defaults to C(both-way) when unset on creation.

options.name: contract_scope
description: The scope of the contract.
This defaults to C(vrf) when unset on creation.

options.name: filter
description: The filter to associate with this contract.

options.name: filter_directives
description: A list of filter directives.

options.name: filter_schema
description: The schema name in which the filter is located.

options.name: filter_template
description: The template name in which the filter is located.

options.name: filter_type
description: The type of filter to manage.

options.name: host
description: IP Address or hostname of the ACI Multi Site Orchestrator host.

options.name: output_level
description: Influence the output of this ACI module.
C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: template
description: The name of the template.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.

author: Dag Wieers (@dagwieers)

Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: schema

options.name: site

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.

options.name: use_proxy

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vlan
description: The VLAN id of the static leaf.

    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    leaf: Leaf1
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a specific site EPG static leaf
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_staticleaf:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    leaf: Leaf1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all site EPG static leafs
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_staticleaf:

C(native) means B(Access (802.1p)).
C(regular) means B(Trunk).

options.name: use_ssl

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.

doc.short_description: Manage site-local EPG static ports in schema template

    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    type: port
    pod: pod-1
    leaf: 101
    path: eth1/1

notes: The ACI MultiSite PATCH API has a deficiency requiring some objects to be referenced by index. This can cause silent corruption on concurrent access when changing/removing on object as the wrong object may be referenced. This module is affected by this deficiency.
Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: bd
description: The name of the BD.

options.name: description
description: The description of this subnet.

options.name: host
description: IP Address or hostname of the ACI Multi Site Orchestrator host.

options.name: no_default_gateway
description: Whether this subnet has a default gateway.

options.name: output_level
description: Influence the output of this ACI module.
C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: scope
description: The scope of the subnet.

options.name: shared
description: Whether this subnet is shared between VRFs.

options.name: site
description: The name of the site.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: subnet
description: The IP range in CIDR notation.

options.name: template
description: The name of the template.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

requirements: Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer
doc.short_description: Manage site-local BD subnets in schema template

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add a new site BD subnet
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_bd_subnet:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    bd: BD1
    subnet: 11.11.11.0/24
    state: present
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Remove a site BD subnet
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_bd_subnet:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    bd: BD1
    subnet: 11.11.11.0/24
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a specific site BD subnet
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_bd_subnet:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    bd: BD1
    subnet: 11.11.11.0/24
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all site BD subnets
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_bd_subnet:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    bd: BD1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

author: Dag Wieers (@dagwieers)
description: Manage schemas on Cisco ACI Multi-Site.
notes: Due to restrictions of the MSO REST API this module cannot create empty schemas (i.e. schemas without templates). Use the M(mso_schema_template) to automatically create schemas with templates.
Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: host
description: IP Address or hostname of the ACI Multi Site Orchestrator host.

options.name: output_level
description: Influence the output of this ACI module.
C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: sites
description: A list of sites mapped to templates in this schema.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: templates
description: A list of templates for this schema.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

requirements: Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer
doc.short_description: Manage schemas

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add a new schema
  cisco.mso.mso_schema:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    state: present
    templates:
    - name: Template1
      displayName: Template 1
      tenantId: north_europe
      anps:
        <...>
    - name: Template2
      displayName: Template 2
      tenantId: nort_europe
      anps:
        <...>
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Remove schemas
  cisco.mso.mso_schema:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a schema
  cisco.mso.mso_schema:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all schemas
  cisco.mso.mso_schema:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

description: Manage BDs in schema templates on Cisco ACI Multi-Site.
notes: Please read the :ref:`aci_guide` for more detailed information on how to manage your ACI infrastructure using Ansible.
This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: bd
description: The name of the BD to manage.

options.name: display_name
description: The name as displayed on the MSO web interface.

options.name: host
description: IP Address or hostname of the ACI Multi Site Orchestrator host.

options.name: intersite_bum_traffic
description: Whether to allow intersite BUM traffic.

options.name: layer2_stretch
description: Whether to enable L2 stretch.

options.name: layer2_unknown_unicast
description: Layer2 unknown unicast.

options.name: layer3_multicast
description: Whether to enable L3 multicast.

options.name: optimize_wan_bandwidth
description: Whether to optimize WAN bandwidth.

options.name: output_level
description: Influence the output of this ACI module.
C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: subnets
description: The subnets associated to this BD.

suboptions.name: description
description: The description of this subnet.

suboptions.name: no_default_gateway
description: Whether this subnet has a default gateway.

suboptions.name: scope
description: The scope of the subnet.

suboptions.name: shared
description: Whether this subnet is shared between VRFs.

suboptions.name: subnet
description: The IP range in CIDR notation.

options.name: template
description: The name of the template.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vrf
description: The VRF associated to this BD. This is required only when creating a new BD.

suboptions.name: name
description: The name of the VRF to associate with.

suboptions.name: schema
description: The schema that defines the referenced VRF.
If this parameter is unspecified, it defaults to the current schema.

suboptions.name: template
description: The template that defines the referenced VRF.
If this parameter is unspecified, it defaults to the current template.

requirements: Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer
doc.short_description: Manage Bridge Domains (BDs) in schema templates

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add a new BD
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_bd:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    bd: BD 1
    vrf:
      name: VRF1
    state: present
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Remove an BD
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_bd:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    bd: BD1
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a specific BDs
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_bd:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    bd: BD1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all BDs
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_template_bd:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema 1
    template: Template 1
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.

options.name: username

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.

doc.short_description: Manage roles

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add a new role
  cisco.mso.mso_role:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    role: readOnly
    display_name: Read Only
    description: Read-only access for troubleshooting
    permissions:
    - view-roles
    - view-schemas
    - view-sites
    - view-tenants
    - view-tenant-schemas
    - view-users
    state: present
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Remove a role
  cisco.mso.mso_role:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    role: readOnly
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a role
  cisco.mso.mso_role:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    role: readOnly
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all roles
  cisco.mso.mso_role:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

description: The deployment immediacy of the domain.

description: The type of domain to associate.

description: The domain profile name.

description: Distinguished name of EPG lagpolicy. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

description: EPG enhanced lagpolicy name. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

description: Virtual LAN for microsegmentation. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.

description: Virtual LAN type for port encap. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

description: Virtual LAN type for port encap. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

description: The name of the schema.

description: The name of the site.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

description: Which switch type to use with this domain association. This attribute can only be used with vmmDomain domain association.

  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_domain:
    host: mso_host

    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    domain_association_type: vmmDomain

    deployment_immediacy: lazy
    resolution_immediacy: pre-provision
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_domain:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword

    template: Template1

author: Dag Wieers (@dagwieers)
description: Manage site-local EPG subnets in schema template on Cisco ACI Multi-Site.

This module was written to support ACI Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer. Some or all functionality may not work on earlier versions.

options.name: anp

options.name: epg
description: The name of the EPG.

options.name: host

options.name: no_default_gateway
description: Whether this subnet has a default gateway.

C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict
C(info) adds informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts
C(debug) adds debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

options.name: password
description: The password to use for authentication.
This option is mutual exclusive with C(private_key). If C(private_key) is provided too, it will be used instead.

options.name: port
description: Port number to be used for the REST connection.
The default value depends on parameter `use_ssl`.

options.name: schema
description: The name of the schema.

options.name: scope
description: The scope of the subnet.

options.name: shared
description: Whether this subnet is shared between VRFs.

options.name: site
description: The name of the site.

options.name: state
description: Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.
Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.

options.name: subnet
description: The IP range in CIDR notation.

options.name: template
description: The name of the template.

options.name: timeout
description: The socket level timeout in seconds.

options.name: use_proxy
description: If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

options.name: use_ssl
description: If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

options.name: username
description: The username to use for authentication.

options.name: validate_certs
description: If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) when used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

requirements: Multi Site Orchestrator v2.1 or newer

- name: Remove a subnet from a site EPG

    host: mso_host

    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    subnet: 10.0.0.0/24
    state: absent
  delegate_to: localhost

- name: Query a specific site EPG subnet
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_subnet:
    host: mso_host
    username: admin
    password: SomeSecretPassword
    schema: Schema1
    site: Site1
    template: Template1
    anp: ANP1
    epg: EPG1
    subnet: 10.0.0.0/24
    state: query
  delegate_to: localhost
  register: query_result

- name: Query all site EPG subnets
  cisco.mso.mso_schema_site_anp_epg_subnet:
